result.execSummary:
The defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid due no later than 07-13-2023.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Defendant is advised as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor. Defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alonzo Detrail Foster

records.addlTxt: Clerical error: corrected to reflect correct sentencing Judge

Defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
EXPEDITED COURT BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 40. Case set for Sentencig Hearing.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 4: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction; with credit for 187 DAYS served.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid due no later than 7-13-2023.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.

e-FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Received and Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Received and Filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a jury trial.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 4:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 5, 6, AND 7 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Received and Filed: Jury Instructions
Received and Filed: Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Received and Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a final pre-trial. Parties still in negotiations. Jury Trial scheduled June 6, 2022 at 9:00 AM. Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing.  Defendant entered a speedy trial demand that expires on 7-14-2022.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for a status conference. Defense requested a plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver, filed.

Defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster in court with Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster in court with attorney Edgar A Beltran.  Defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
